attributes.action: Charge people who attend A&E when their visit has been necessary due to alcohol
attributes.additional_details: Recent news coverage in TV and radio on Tuesday 22nd Decenber 2015
attributes.background: Recent news articles say 75% of those that attend A&E do so because of alcohol-related injuries or illness putting excessive financial pressure on the NHS and the service does not have the staffing capacity to cope. A standard £100 charge with a fine of £250 for those who have had x-rays/admission
